intro: Euchaetis radiata, commonly known as the radiate euchaetis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow-orange ray florets surrounding a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Euchaetis radiata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun.
